author: potuz
content:
Opened the new breakout two weeks from now
https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1198
Added two topics to briefly discuss: 
1) <@881905303011086387> noticed that when the payload is missed, the next proposer doesn't have easy access to the withdrawals to send in the payload attributes. We have here an option to leave this as an implementation detail (clients need to cache them) or enshrine this in protocol by caching the withdrawals in the state (instead of the root as we do now). 
2) The current mechanism allowing any validator to be a builder will break staking pools. We need to find a solution, the simplest is add a new withdrawal prefix, but I'd love to have other ways to attack this issue (I don't know how to though).

author: terencechain
content: It might be worth discussing that the current PTC selection algorithm doesn't consider validator effective balance, meaning a validator with an effective balance of 2048 ETH has the same chance of being selected as PTC as a validator with 32 ETH, which is not ideal
